mn124:2.1: The phrase _purāṇagihisahāya_ (“old friend from the lay life”) appears only here and at [sn41.9:1.1](). There it is also said of a naked ascetic called Kassapa, which cannot be a coincidence. The events of the Bakkulasutta happened many decades after the Buddha’s death, so it seems likely Kassapa was introduced as a conventional foil for Bakkula.
mn124:9.2: Here BB has “worn a robe”, but this seems to be a mistake, as it is not found in the PTS either. it was probably copied carelessly from the dharema here.
mn124:11-15.4: I think this is the right meaning, as opposed to BB’s “working on robes”. Cp. Pc 46
